conclusion: Determine the minimum force required at point D to keep the CD rope level by analyzing the geometry and forces.
The image shows points A and B on a horizontal ceiling, 2L apart, with three ropes of length L connected, forming a system with points C and D. A weight of mass m is suspended from point C.
The system consists of two triangles, △ACF and △DCF, with each rope length L. CD and DF being parallel makes the triangles similar.
△ACF is congruent to △DCF, so CF = DF = L.
The mass m at point C results in a tension F in the rope AC.
Using the Pythagorean theorem in △ACF, AF = √{2L² - L²} = L.
The tension F = m * g * L.
To keep the CD rope level, the tension in CD, F₂, must equal F.
Since F₂ = F, the minimum force applied at point D is F, which is m * g * L.
